status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: As a cloudformation user, I would like to be able to run the ContinueUpdateRollback API call if update rollback fails.

comments.body: In order to test this, update must work until some final error causes rollback to kick in, but then the updates that worked need to fail 'in reverse'.  One way to do this is to create a stack that has some security groups, and the updated version contains ingress/egress rules.  A user who has the Deny IAM action on ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupIngress and/or ec2:RevokeSecurityGroupEgress will be able to add ingress/egress rules but not remove them, allowing rollback to fail.  Either using the admin account, or granting these IAM actions to the user should allow the ContinueUpdateRollback action to succeed.  euca2ools does not to my knowledge yet support continue update rollback, so boto or the AWS SDK may be used.
